main event: On 8 Jun 55 in Rockville, Md., a fast-moving object the size of a jet was observed at an angle of about 45 degrees, making no sound and not changing course or speed while in view.
interesting points: The object moved across the sky very fast from east to west at an angle of about 45 degrees, resembling a matador missile with a trail of flame.
The observation lasted for about 1 minute, and the object made no sound while in view.
The object did not fit the description of any known aircraft and was of undetermined nature.
The sighting was made by a credible witness, William B. Jakeway, Major, 573 Support Squadron, Fort Meade, Maryland.
The object was initially mistaken for a comet due to its appearance and speed.
sighted object: fast-moving object the size of a jet
witnesses: William B. Jakeway, Major, 573 Support Squadron, Fort Meade, Maryland
